title: 5 ways to help fight food insecurity in the North Shore right now
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Support Beverly Bootstraps by building snack bags or organizing food drives for children in need.
Volunteer or donate to La Colaborativa in Chelsea which operates a new food pantry for residents.
Contribute to Lynn Community Fridge, open 24/7, managed by the Lynn Family Resource Center.

title: SNAP fully funded, Healey says, as she urges residents to use benefits
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: SNAP benefits in Massachusetts are now fully funded, Governor Maura Healey announced, urging residents to utilize the program.
A federal judge temporarily blocked the Trump administration's directive to revoke issued SNAP benefits during the government shutdown.
Healey criticized the Trump administration's handling of SNAP and the ongoing shutdown, citing the need for ACA tax credit extensions.

title: Falmouth to vote on turning historic golf course into solar farm
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Falmouth residents to vote on converting Cape Cod Country Club into solar farm and conservation area on Nov. 17.
The project could generate over 29,000 megawatt-hours annually, powering 7% of Barnstable County's electricity.
Opponents cite the course's historic significance and advocate for preservation or alternative housing development.

title: Look inside Sheraton Boston’s whimsical new Goodnight Moon suite
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Sheraton Boston Hotel introduces a 'Goodnight Moon' themed suite available until February 28, 2026.
The suite recreates the 'Great Green Room' from the 1947 children's book, offering a family-friendly experience.
Guests receive four Boston View tickets and a $150 dining credit; project part of 'Goodnight Room' campaign.

title: 2 kilos of fentanyl recovered after investigation into Southwest Corridor drug activity, police say
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police recovered over 2 kilograms of fentanyl from Dorchester, Mattapan, and Roxbury following a Southwest Corridor drug investigation.
Five individuals were arrested during the operation, with charges including fentanyl trafficking and unlawful possession of ammunition.
Among those charged, Bryan Mejia and Jeiel Hernandez pled not guilty and will reappear in Roxbury Municipal Court on December 1.

title: 2 MBTA operators sent to hospital after fallen wire causes fire near BC
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Two MBTA operators hospitalized for smoke inhalation after fallen wire sparked a fire near Boston College.
110 feet of overhead catenary wire caused flames and arcing upon contact with an out-of-service Green Line trolley.
MBTA service on the B Branch was disrupted, with shuttle buses running until regular service resumed by 11:20 p.m.

title: Abandoned manor overlooking the ocean gets new life in Nahant â€” thanks to Instagram
author: Regina Cole
bullets: The Howe Mansion in Nahant, built in 1880, is listed for $5.5 million after extensive renovations.
Developers restored the Queen Anne style mansion after it was abandoned and vandalized, incorporating modern amenities.
Real estate developer Ricky Beliveau was inspired to renovate the mansion following an Instagram suggestion.

title: Review & setlist: Natalie Merchant strips back the music in support of Beverly’s Grateful Friends
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Natalie Merchant performed a stripped-back concert at The Cabot in Beverly on November 9, 2025.
The concert supported Grateful Friends, a local nonprofit assisting cancer patients with essential expenses.
Merchant was accompanied only by guitarist Erik Della Penna, offering intimate versions of her and 10,000 Maniacs songs.

title: ‘Confusing’: What readers think of hybrid traffic lights
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Massachusetts has about 40 hybrid traffic lights, with many drivers uncertain about how to follow their sequence.
UMass Amherst study found 65% of drivers violated hybrid light signals, misinterpreting flashing and solid reds.
Boston.com poll shows 59% of readers find hybrid traffic lights confusing; calls for better public education.

title: 230 UMass Amherst students displaced after fire at off-campus apartment complex
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A three-alarm fire at 57 Olympia Drive displaced 232 UMass Amherst students, the largest in local fire department history.
Wind-driven flames from a construction site at 8:18 p.m. Friday led to building demolishment due to structural instability.
No injuries reported, but lost pets and belongings prompted state of emergency, with aid provided by UMass and emergency agencies.
